page.title: 19SOUTH WEALD. BRENTWOOD
page.content:
South Weald is a small village{2km} W.of Brentwood.There is very little developement in South Weald as it is part of the{Green Belt}.It has one Church of England primary school and a Church called St.Peters.The main attraction is the country park.The surrounding land is mostly farmland and deciduous trees.There are no shops but one Public House-The Tower Arms- opposite the Church.
Although Weald is only small the primary school has about{300}pupils and children from Brentwood travel there by bus.Part of South Weald's buildings include the 10 alms houses that date from 1870.These are for the elderly.Since 1966 two new ones have been built.
